text.p: The average yield at the latest auction of three-month discount treasury bills fell to 57.25 from 57.30 percent at the last sale on August 29, a Ukrainian central bank official said on Wednesday.

The central bank is setting the denominations of T-bills at 100 hryvnya, compared to 10 million karbovanets before Ukraine implemented its monetary reform programme by introducing the new currency on Monday.
The results of Tuesday's auction, compared to the last issue of three-month T-bills, were as follows:
Amount sold 25.52 million UAH 589.4 billion UAK
Actual amount raised 22.33 million UAH 515.7 billion UAK
Ukraine's central bank sold 255,212 T-bills, the bank's statement said. Of those 90,274 were competitive and 164,938 were non-competitive bids.
The next auction of discount three-month T-bills is unfixed.
The average yield at the latest auction of six-month discount treasury bills also fell to 64.38 percent against 64.87 percent at the last sale on August 29, a central bank statement said.
The results of Tuesday's auction, compared to the last issue of six-month discount T-bills, were as follows:
Amount sold 9.128 million UAH 692.9 billion UAK
Actual amount raised 6.910 million UAH 523.5 billion UAK
Of the 91,288 T-bills sold by the central bank, 64,062 were competitive and 27,226 were non-competitive bids.
The date of the next auction of six-month discount T-bills is unfixed.
Auctions of nine-month and 12-month discount T-bills were also scheduled for Tuesday but were ordered cancelled by the Finance Ministry.
